intro: Cyphocarpa, commonly known as the false sandcherry, is a genus of flowering plants in the rose family. It consists of a single species, Cyphocarpa tetragona, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is a shrub characterized by its small, yellow flowers and red, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features include compound leaves and a woody stem, typical of many plants in the Rosaceae family. Cyphocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
